intro: Ricinocarpus peckoltii, commonly known as the peckoltii sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its morphology includes grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often inconspicuous. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential adaptations to wetland ecosystems.
